trans-unit.source: This topic provides a reference for the following API Management policies.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides a reference for the following API Management policies.

trans-unit.source: For information on adding and configuring policies, see <externalLink><linkText>Policies in API Management</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=398186</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information on adding and configuring policies, see <externalLink><linkText>Policies in API Management</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=398186</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#ConvertJSONtoXML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Convert JSON to XML</link> - Converts request or response body from JSON to XML.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#ConvertJSONtoXML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Convert JSON to XML</link> - Converts request or response body from JSON to XML.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#ConvertXMLtoJSON" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Convert XML to JSON</link> - Converts request or response body from XML to JSON.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#ConvertXMLtoJSON" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Convert XML to JSON</link> - Converts request or response body from XML to JSON.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#Findandreplacestringinbody" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Find and replace string in body</link> - Finds a request or response substring and replaces it with a different substring.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#Findandreplacestringinbody" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Find and replace string in body</link> - Finds a request or response substring and replaces it with a different substring.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#MaskURLSContent" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Mask URLs in content</link> - Re-writes (masks) links in the response body and in the location header so that they point to the equivalent link via the proxy.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#MaskURLSContent" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Mask URLs in content</link> - Re-writes (masks) links in the response body and in the location header so that they point to the equivalent link via the proxy.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#SetBackendService" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set backend service</link> - Changes the backend service for an incoming request.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#SetBackendService" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set backend service</link> - Changes the backend service for an incoming request.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#SetBody" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set body</link> - Sets the message body for incoming and outgoing requests.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#SetBody" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set body</link> - Sets the message body for incoming and outgoing requests.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#SetHTTPheader" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set HTTP header</link> - Assigns a value to an existing response and/or request header or adds a new response and/or request header.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#SetHTTPheader" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set HTTP header</link> - Assigns a value to an existing response and/or request header or adds a new response and/or request header.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#SetQueryStringParameter" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set query string parameter</link> - Adds, replaces value of, or deletes request query string parameter.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#SetQueryStringParameter" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set query string parameter</link> - Adds, replaces value of, or deletes request query string parameter.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#RewriteURL" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rewrite URL</link> - Converts a request URL from its public form to the form expected by the web service.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#RewriteURL" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rewrite URL</link> - Converts a request URL from its public form to the form expected by the web service.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>json-to-xml</codeInline> policy converts a request or response body from JSON to XML.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>json-to-xml</codeInline> policy converts a request or response body from JSON to XML.

trans-unit.source: The attribute must be set to one of the following values.
trans-unit.target: The attribute must be set to one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: content-type-json - convert only if response Content-Type header indicates presence of JSON.
trans-unit.target: content-type-json - convert only if response Content-Type header indicates presence of JSON.

trans-unit.source: The attribute must be set to one of the following values.
trans-unit.target: The attribute must be set to one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: true - apply conversion if JSON is requested in request Accept header.
trans-unit.target: true - apply conversion if JSON is requested in request Accept header.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>xml-to-json</codeInline> policy converts a request or response body from XML to JSON.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>xml-to-json</codeInline> policy converts a request or response body from XML to JSON.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used to modernize APIs based on XML-only backend web services.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used to modernize APIs based on XML-only backend web services.

trans-unit.source: The attribute must be set to one of the following values.
trans-unit.target: The attribute must be set to one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: javascript-friendly - the converted JSON has a form friendly to JavaScript developers.
trans-unit.target: javascript-friendly - the converted JSON has a form friendly to JavaScript developers.

trans-unit.source: direct - the converted JSON reflects the original XML document's structure.
trans-unit.target: direct - the converted JSON reflects the original XML document's structure.

trans-unit.source: The attribute must be set to one of the following values.
trans-unit.target: The attribute must be set to one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: content-type-xml - convert only if response Content-Type header indicates presence of XML.
trans-unit.target: content-type-xml - convert only if response Content-Type header indicates presence of XML.

trans-unit.source: The attribute must be set to one of the following values.
trans-unit.target: The attribute must be set to one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: true - apply conversion if XML is requested in request Accept header.
trans-unit.target: true - apply conversion if XML is requested in request Accept header.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Find and replace string in body
trans-unit.target: Find and replace string in body

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>find-and-replace</codeInline> policy finds a request or response substring and replaces it with a different substring.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>find-and-replace</codeInline> policy finds a request or response substring and replaces it with a different substring.

trans-unit.source: Specify a zero length replacement string to remove the search string.
trans-unit.target: Specify a zero length replacement string to remove the search string.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>redirect-body-urls</codeInline> policy re-writes (masks) links in the response body and in the location header so that they point to the equivalent link via the proxy.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>redirect-body-urls</codeInline> policy re-writes (masks) links in the response body and in the location header so that they point to the equivalent link via the proxy.

trans-unit.source: Use in the outbound section to re-write response body links and Location header values to make them point to the proxy.
trans-unit.target: Use in the outbound section to re-write response body links and Location header values to make them point to the proxy.

trans-unit.source: Use in the inbound section for an opposite effect.
trans-unit.target: Use in the inbound section for an opposite effect.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Use the <codeInline>set-backend-service</codeInline> policy to redirect an incoming request to a different backend than the one specified in the API settings for that operation.
trans-unit.target: Use the <codeInline>set-backend-service</codeInline> policy to redirect an incoming request to a different backend than the one specified in the API settings for that operation.

trans-unit.source: This policy changes the backend service base URL of the incoming request to the one specified in the policy.
trans-unit.target: This policy changes the backend service base URL of the incoming request to the one specified in the policy.

trans-unit.source: In this example the set backend service policy routes requests based on the version value passed in the query string to a different backend service than the one specified in the API.
trans-unit.target: In this example the set backend service policy routes requests based on the version value passed in the query string to a different backend service than the one specified in the API.

trans-unit.source: Initially the backend service base URL is derived from the API settings.
trans-unit.target: Initially the backend service base URL is derived from the API settings.

trans-unit.source: So the request URL <codeInline>https://contoso.azure-api.net/api/partners/15?version=2013-05%%amp;amp;subscription-key=abcdef</codeInline> becomes <codeInline>http://contoso.com/api/10.4/partners/15?version=2013-05%%amp;amp;subscription-key=abcdef</codeInline> where <codeInline>http://contoso.com/api/10.4/</codeInline> is the backend service URL specified in the API settings.
trans-unit.target: So the request URL <codeInline>https://contoso.azure-api.net/api/partners/15?version=2013-05%%amp;amp;subscription-key=abcdef</codeInline> becomes <codeInline>http://contoso.com/api/10.4/partners/15?version=2013-05%%amp;amp;subscription-key=abcdef</codeInline> where <codeInline>http://contoso.com/api/10.4/</codeInline> is the backend service URL specified in the API settings.

trans-unit.source: When the <legacyLink xlink:href="8a13348b-7856-428f-8e35-9e4273d94323#choose" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><choose></legacyLink> policy statement is applied the backend service base URL may change again either to <codeInline>http://contoso.com/api/8.2</codeInline> or <codeInline>http://contoso.com/api/9.1</codeInline>, depending on the value of the version request query parameter.
trans-unit.target: When the <legacyLink xlink:href="8a13348b-7856-428f-8e35-9e4273d94323#choose" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><choose></legacyLink> policy statement is applied the backend service base URL may change again either to <codeInline>http://contoso.com/api/8.2</codeInline> or <codeInline>http://contoso.com/api/9.1</codeInline>, depending on the value of the version request query parameter.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the value is <codeInline>"2013-15"</codeInline> the final request URL becomes <codeInline>http://contoso.com/api/8.2/partners/15?version=2013-05%%amp;amp;subscription-key=abcdef</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the value is <codeInline>"2013-15"</codeInline> the final request URL becomes <codeInline>http://contoso.com/api/8.2/partners/15?version=2013-05%%amp;amp;subscription-key=abcdef</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: If further transformation of the request is desired, other <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#TransformationPolicies" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Transformation policies</link> can be used.
trans-unit.target: If further transformation of the request is desired, other <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#TransformationPolicies" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Transformation policies</link> can be used.

trans-unit.source: For example, to remove the version query parameter now that the request is being routed to a version specific backend, the <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#SetQueryStringParameter" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set query string parameter</link> policy can be used to remove the now redundant version attribute.
trans-unit.target: For example, to remove the version query parameter now that the request is being routed to a version specific backend, the <link xlink:href="7406a8ce-5f9c-4fae-9b0f-e574befb2ee9#SetQueryStringParameter" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Set query string parameter</link> policy can be used to remove the now redundant version attribute.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Use the <codeInline>set-body</codeInline> policy to set the message body for incoming and outgoing requests.
trans-unit.target: Use the <codeInline>set-body</codeInline> policy to set the message body for incoming and outgoing requests.

trans-unit.source: To access the message body you can use the <codeInline>context.Request.Body</codeInline> property or the <codeInline>context.Response.Body</codeInline>, depending on whether the policy is in the inbound or outbound section.
trans-unit.target: To access the message body you can use the <codeInline>context.Request.Body</codeInline> property or the <codeInline>context.Response.Body</codeInline>, depending on whether the policy is in the inbound or outbound section.

trans-unit.source: Note that by default when you access the message body using <codeInline>context.Request.Body</codeInline> or <codeInline>context.Response.Body</codeInline>, the original message body is lost and must be set by returning the body back in the expression.
trans-unit.target: Note that by default when you access the message body using <codeInline>context.Request.Body</codeInline> or <codeInline>context.Response.Body</codeInline>, the original message body is lost and must be set by returning the body back in the expression.

trans-unit.source: To preserve the body content, set the <codeInline>preserveContent</codeInline> parameter to <codeInline>true</codeInline> when accessing the message.
trans-unit.target: To preserve the body content, set the <codeInline>preserveContent</codeInline> parameter to <codeInline>true</codeInline> when accessing the message.

trans-unit.source: If <codeInline>preserveContent</codeInline> is set to <codeInline>true</codeInline> and a different body is returned by the expression, the returned body is used.
trans-unit.target: If <codeInline>preserveContent</codeInline> is set to <codeInline>true</codeInline> and a different body is returned by the expression, the returned body is used.

trans-unit.source: Please note the following considerations when using the <codeInline>set-body</codeInline> policy.
trans-unit.target: Please note the following considerations when using the <codeInline>set-body</codeInline> policy.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the <codeInline>set-body</codeInline> policy to return a new or updated body you don't need to set <codeInline>preserveContent</codeInline> to <codeInline>true</codeInline> because you are explicitly supplying the new body contents.
trans-unit.target: If you are using the <codeInline>set-body</codeInline> policy to return a new or updated body you don't need to set <codeInline>preserveContent</codeInline> to <codeInline>true</codeInline> because you are explicitly supplying the new body contents.

trans-unit.source: Preserving the content of a response in the inbound pipeline doesn't make sense because there is no response yet.
trans-unit.target: Preserving the content of a response in the inbound pipeline doesn't make sense because there is no response yet.

trans-unit.source: Preserving the content of a request in the outbound pipeline doesn't make sense because the request has already been sent to the backend at this point.
trans-unit.target: Preserving the content of a request in the outbound pipeline doesn't make sense because the request has already been sent to the backend at this point.

trans-unit.source: If this policy is used when there is no message body, for example in an inbound GET, an exception is thrown.
trans-unit.target: If this policy is used when there is no message body, for example in an inbound GET, an exception is thrown.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> the <codeInline>context.Request.Body</codeInline>, <codeInline>context.Response.Body</codeInline>, and the <codeInline>IMessage</codeInline> sections in the <link xlink:href="ea160028-fc04-4782-aa26-4b8329df3448#ContextVariables" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Context variable</link> table.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> the <codeInline>context.Request.Body</codeInline>, <codeInline>context.Response.Body</codeInline>, and the <codeInline>IMessage</codeInline> sections in the <link xlink:href="ea160028-fc04-4782-aa26-4b8329df3448#ContextVariables" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Context variable</link> table.

trans-unit.source: Example accessing the body as a string
trans-unit.target: Example accessing the body as a string

trans-unit.source: Example accessing the body as a JObject
trans-unit.target: Example accessing the body as a JObject

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to perform content filtering by removing data elements from the response received from the backend service when using the <codeInline>Starter</codeInline> product.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to perform content filtering by removing data elements from the response received from the backend service when using the <codeInline>Starter</codeInline> product.

trans-unit.source: For a demonstration of configuring and using this policy, see <externalLink><linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features with Vlad Vinogradsky</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/episode-177-more-api-management-features-with-vlad-vinogradsky/</linkUri></externalLink> and fast-forward to 34:30.
trans-unit.target: For a demonstration of configuring and using this policy, see <externalLink><linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features with Vlad Vinogradsky</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/episode-177-more-api-management-features-with-vlad-vinogradsky/</linkUri></externalLink> and fast-forward to 34:30.

trans-unit.source: Start at 31:50 to see an overview of <externalLink><linkText>The Dark Sky Forecast API</linkText><linkUri>https://developer.forecast.io/</linkUri></externalLink> used for this demo.
trans-unit.target: Start at 31:50 to see an overview of <externalLink><linkText>The Dark Sky Forecast API</linkText><linkUri>https://developer.forecast.io/</linkUri></externalLink> used for this demo.

trans-unit.source: Contains the body text or an expressions that returns a body.
trans-unit.target: Contains the body text or an expressions that returns a body.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>set-header</codeInline> policy assigns a value to an existing response and/or request header or adds a new response and/or request header.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>set-header</codeInline> policy assigns a value to an existing response and/or request header or adds a new response and/or request header.

trans-unit.source: Inserts a list of HTTP headers into an HTTP message.
trans-unit.target: Inserts a list of HTTP headers into an HTTP message.

trans-unit.source: When placed in an inbound pipeline, this policy sets the HTTP headers for the request being passed to the target service.
trans-unit.target: When placed in an inbound pipeline, this policy sets the HTTP headers for the request being passed to the target service.

trans-unit.source: When placed in an outbound pipeline, this policy sets the HTTP headers for the response being sent to the proxy’s client.
trans-unit.target: When placed in an outbound pipeline, this policy sets the HTTP headers for the response being sent to the proxy’s client.

trans-unit.source: Forward context information to the backend service
trans-unit.target: Forward context information to the backend service

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to apply policy at the API level to supply context information to the backend service.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to apply policy at the API level to supply context information to the backend service.

trans-unit.source: For a demonstration of configuring and using this policy, see <externalLink><linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features with Vlad Vinogradsky</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/episode-177-more-api-management-features-with-vlad-vinogradsky/</linkUri></externalLink> and fast-forward to 10:30.
trans-unit.target: For a demonstration of configuring and using this policy, see <externalLink><linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features with Vlad Vinogradsky</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/episode-177-more-api-management-features-with-vlad-vinogradsky/</linkUri></externalLink> and fast-forward to 10:30.

trans-unit.source: At 12:10 there is a demo of calling an operation in the developer portal where you can see the policy at work.
trans-unit.target: At 12:10 there is a demo of calling an operation in the developer portal where you can see the policy at work.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the value of the header to be set.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the value of the header to be set.

trans-unit.source: For multiple headers with the same name add additional <codeInline>value</codeInline> elements.
trans-unit.target: For multiple headers with the same name add additional <codeInline>value</codeInline> elements.

trans-unit.source: Specifies what action to take when the header is already specified.
trans-unit.target: Specifies what action to take when the header is already specified.

trans-unit.source: This attribute must have one of the following values.
trans-unit.target: This attribute must have one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: override - replaces the value of the existing header.
trans-unit.target: override - replaces the value of the existing header.

trans-unit.source: skip - does not replace the existing header value.
trans-unit.target: skip - does not replace the existing header value.

trans-unit.source: append - appends the value to the existing header value.
trans-unit.target: append - appends the value to the existing header value.

trans-unit.source: delete - removes the header from the request.
trans-unit.target: delete - removes the header from the request.

trans-unit.source: When set to <codeInline>override</codeInline> enlisting multiple entries with the same name results in the header being set according to all entries (which will be listed multiple times); only listed values will be set in the result.
trans-unit.target: When set to <codeInline>override</codeInline> enlisting multiple entries with the same name results in the header being set according to all entries (which will be listed multiple times); only listed values will be set in the result.

trans-unit.source: Specifies name of the header to be set.
trans-unit.target: Specifies name of the header to be set.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>set-query-parameter</codeInline> policy adds, replaces value of, or deletes request query string parameter.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>set-query-parameter</codeInline> policy adds, replaces value of, or deletes request query string parameter.

trans-unit.source: Can be used to pass query parameters expected by the backend service which are optional or never present in the request.
trans-unit.target: Can be used to pass query parameters expected by the backend service which are optional or never present in the request.

trans-unit.source: Forward context information to the backend service
trans-unit.target: Forward context information to the backend service

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to apply policy at the API level to supply context information to the backend service.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to apply policy at the API level to supply context information to the backend service.

trans-unit.source: For a demonstration of configuring and using this policy, see <externalLink><linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features with Vlad Vinogradsky</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/episode-177-more-api-management-features-with-vlad-vinogradsky/</linkUri></externalLink> and fast-forward to 10:30.
trans-unit.target: For a demonstration of configuring and using this policy, see <externalLink><linkText>Cloud Cover Episode 177: More API Management Features with Vlad Vinogradsky</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/episode-177-more-api-management-features-with-vlad-vinogradsky/</linkUri></externalLink> and fast-forward to 10:30.

trans-unit.source: At 12:10 there is a demo of calling an operation in the developer portal where you can see the policy at work.
trans-unit.target: At 12:10 there is a demo of calling an operation in the developer portal where you can see the policy at work.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the value of the query parameter to be set.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the value of the query parameter to be set.

trans-unit.source: For multiple query parameters with the same name add additional <codeInline>value</codeInline> elements.
trans-unit.target: For multiple query parameters with the same name add additional <codeInline>value</codeInline> elements.

trans-unit.source: Specifies what action to take when the query parameter is already specified.
trans-unit.target: Specifies what action to take when the query parameter is already specified.

trans-unit.source: This attribute must have one of the following values.
trans-unit.target: This attribute must have one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: override - replaces the value of the existing parameter.
trans-unit.target: override - replaces the value of the existing parameter.

trans-unit.source: skip - does not replace the existing query parameter value.
trans-unit.target: skip - does not replace the existing query parameter value.

trans-unit.source: append - appends the value to the existing query parameter value.
trans-unit.target: append - appends the value to the existing query parameter value.

trans-unit.source: delete - removes the query parameter from the request.
trans-unit.target: delete - removes the query parameter from the request.

trans-unit.source: When set to <codeInline>override</codeInline> enlisting multiple entries with the same name results in the query parameter being set according to all entries (which will be listed multiple times); only listed values will be set in the result.
trans-unit.target: When set to <codeInline>override</codeInline> enlisting multiple entries with the same name results in the query parameter being set according to all entries (which will be listed multiple times); only listed values will be set in the result.

trans-unit.source: Specifies name of the query parameter to be set.
trans-unit.target: Specifies name of the query parameter to be set.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <codeInline>rewrite-uri</codeInline> policy converts a request URL from its public form to the form expected by the web service, as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: The <codeInline>rewrite-uri</codeInline> policy converts a request URL from its public form to the form expected by the web service, as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used when a human and/or browser-friendly URL should be transformed into the URL format expected by the web service.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used when a human and/or browser-friendly URL should be transformed into the URL format expected by the web service.

trans-unit.source: This policy only needs to be applied when exposing an alternative URL format, such as clean URLs, RESTful URLs, user-friendly URLs or SEO-friendly URLs that are purely structural URLs that do not contain a query string and instead contain only the path of the resource (after the scheme and the authority).
trans-unit.target: This policy only needs to be applied when exposing an alternative URL format, such as clean URLs, RESTful URLs, user-friendly URLs or SEO-friendly URLs that are purely structural URLs that do not contain a query string and instead contain only the path of the resource (after the scheme and the authority).

trans-unit.source: This is often done for aesthetic, usability, or search engine optimization (SEO) purposes.
trans-unit.target: This is often done for aesthetic, usability, or search engine optimization (SEO) purposes.

trans-unit.source: You can only add query string parameters using the policy.
trans-unit.target: You can only add query string parameters using the policy.

trans-unit.source: You cannot add extra template path parameters in the rewrite URL.
trans-unit.target: You cannot add extra template path parameters in the rewrite URL.

trans-unit.source: The actual web service URL with any query string parameters.
trans-unit.target: The actual web service URL with any query string parameters.

trans-unit.source: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: This policy can be used in the following policy <externalLink><linkText>sections</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#sections</linkUri></externalLink> and <externalLink><linkText>scopes</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/api-management-howto-policies/#scopes</linkUri></externalLink>.
